answers.answer:
You can legally enter Romania by obtaining temporary protection, with a short-stay right, or as an asylum seeker.

To find detailed information, visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and read the initial section titled 'The main ways to enter Romania'.
answers.bResponse:
You can legally enter Romania by obtaining temporary protection, with a short-stay right, or as an asylum seeker.

To find detailed information, visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and read the initial section titled 'The main ways to enter Romania'. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Individual rights in Romania differ significantly based on one's status, with beneficiaries of temporary protection having immediate work eligibility and broad access to state education, while those with a short-stay status typically require a work permit for employment, and asylum seekers can work only after a waiting period or obtaining refugee status.

You can find detailed information on these rights by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and navigating to the sections titled 'My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection', 'My rights having a short stay status', and 'My rights as an asylum seeker'.
answers.bResponse:
Individual rights in Romania differ significantly based on one's status, with beneficiaries of temporary protection having immediate work eligibility and broad access to state education, while those with a short-stay status typically require a work permit for employment, and asylum seekers can work only after a waiting period or obtaining refugee status.

You can find detailed information on these rights by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and navigating to the sections titled 'My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection', 'My rights having a short stay status', and 'My rights as an asylum seeker'. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Beneficiaries of temporary protection in Romania have the right to be issued a residence permit, receive information about their protection, work without a visa or work permit, and access education and medical assistance. They can also benefit from family reunification, social services, and assistance for maintenance if they lack material means.

You can find detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights, specifically under the section titled "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection".
answers.bResponse:
Beneficiaries of temporary protection in Romania have the right to be issued a residence permit, receive information about their protection, work without a visa or work permit, and access education and medical assistance. They can also benefit from family reunification, social services, and assistance for maintenance if they lack material means.

You can find detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights, specifically under the section titled "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Yes, individuals with temporary protection status in Romania can work and be hired on the basis of a residence permit, without needing an employment notice or visa.

To find this information, go to the website and look under the section titled "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection," then navigate to "The right to work."
answers.bResponse:
Yes, individuals with temporary protection status in Romania can work and be hired on the basis of a residence permit, without needing an employment notice or visa.

To find this information, go to the website and look under the section titled "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection," then navigate to "The right to work." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Yes, people with temporary protection in Romania can benefit, upon request, from necessary assistance for maintenance if they do not have the required material means, though there is currently no direct financial support for renting a home.

To find detailed information, go to `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and navigate to the section titled "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection." You will find this information under point d) and the "Accommodation" subsection.
answers.bResponse:
Yes, people with temporary protection in Romania can benefit, upon request, from necessary assistance for maintenance if they do not have the required material means, though there is currently no direct financial support for renting a home.

To find detailed information, go to `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and navigate to the section titled "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection." You will find this information under point d) and the "Accommodation" subsection. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Individuals under temporary protection in Romania benefit from medical services, medical supplies, medicines, medical devices, and services included in national curative health programs, similar to insured Romanian citizens, without paying social health insurance contributions or co-payment for outpatient medicines. They also receive adequate medical assistance if they have special needs, and primary health care, emergency medical care, and free treatment for acute or chronic life-threatening diseases are ensured in temporary accommodation camps.

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and read under the section "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection," specifically the subsection "Medical assistance."
answers.bResponse:
Individuals under temporary protection in Romania benefit from medical services, medical supplies, medicines, medical devices, and services included in national curative health programs, similar to insured Romanian citizens, without paying social health insurance contributions or co-payment for outpatient medicines. They also receive adequate medical assistance if they have special needs, and primary health care, emergency medical care, and free treatment for acute or chronic life-threatening diseases are ensured in temporary accommodation camps.

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and read under the section "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection," specifically the subsection "Medical assistance." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Yes, children under temporary protection in Romania have the right to access the state education system under the same conditions as Romanian citizens if they are under 18 years old. Ukrainian children specifically benefit from the right to education in Romanian schools under the same conditions as Romanians.

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and read under the section "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection" specifically point 'g', and also the section titled "The right for education".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, children under temporary protection in Romania have the right to access the state education system under the same conditions as Romanian citizens if they are under 18 years old. Ukrainian children specifically benefit from the right to education in Romanian schools under the same conditions as Romanians.

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and read under the section "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection" specifically point 'g', and also the section titled "The right for education". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Yes, families separated by conflict can be reunited in Romania under temporary protection, including cases where family members are in different Member States or are not yet in Romania, provided they need protection. This applies to spouses, unmarried minor children, and parents of minor beneficiaries.

To find this detailed information, go to the website and look for the section titled "Reuniting families" under the "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection" section.
answers.bResponse:
Yes, families separated by conflict can be reunited in Romania under temporary protection, including cases where family members are in different Member States or are not yet in Romania, provided they need protection. This applies to spouses, unmarried minor children, and parents of minor beneficiaries.

To find this detailed information, go to the website and look for the section titled "Reuniting families" under the "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection" section. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Yes, social services are provided for people with temporary protection in Romania, including food, clothing, personal hygiene products, and primary and emergency medical care within temporary accommodation and humanitarian assistance camps. They can also request necessary assistance for maintenance if they lack material means.

To find this detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and read under the section "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection," specifically the subsection titled "Social services."
answers.bResponse:
Yes, social services are provided for people with temporary protection in Romania, including food, clothing, personal hygiene products, and primary and emergency medical care within temporary accommodation and humanitarian assistance camps. They can also request necessary assistance for maintenance if they lack material means.

To find this detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and read under the section "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection," specifically the subsection titled "Social services." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
There is currently no direct financial support for renting a home for those with temporary protection in Romania. However, individuals and legal entities hosting people from the conflict zone in Ukraine can receive reimbursement for daily accommodation and food expenses.

To find more detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and look under the "Accommodation" section, which applies to those with temporary protection.
answers.bResponse:
There is currently no direct financial support for renting a home for those with temporary protection in Romania. However, individuals and legal entities hosting people from the conflict zone in Ukraine can receive reimbursement for daily accommodation and food expenses.

To find more detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and look under the "Accommodation" section, which applies to those with temporary protection. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Ukrainian citizens residing in Romania can receive pension payments by undergoing remote verification through the Dіya online service, the Pension Fund's call center, or by confirming their residence via a consular officer at the Embassy of Ukraine. Pensions can also be received by international transfers through Ukrposhta if they previously received them in cash in Ukraine, and those who reached retirement age abroad can apply remotely via the Pension Fund of Ukraine's web services portal.

You can find this detailed information on the webpage `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` under the "Pension" section.
answers.bResponse:
Ukrainian citizens residing in Romania can receive pension payments by undergoing remote verification through the Dіya online service, the Pension Fund's call center, or by confirming their residence via a consular officer at the Embassy of Ukraine. Pensions can also be received by international transfers through Ukrposhta if they previously received them in cash in Ukraine, and those who reached retirement age abroad can apply remotely via the Pension Fund of Ukraine's web services portal.

You can find this detailed information on the webpage `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` under the "Pension" section. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Yes, individuals with a short-stay right can work in Romania, but they must apply for a work permit at the General Inspectorate for Immigration.

To find this information, go to the website and look under the section titled "My rights having a short stay status," then navigate to the "Work" subsection.
answers.bResponse:
Yes, individuals with a short-stay right can work in Romania, but they must apply for a work permit at the General Inspectorate for Immigration.

To find this information, go to the website and look under the section titled "My rights having a short stay status," then navigate to the "Work" subsection. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
People with a short-stay right in Romania receive primary health care, emergency medical care, and free medical care for acute or chronic life-threatening diseases through the national health care system. They also benefit from comprehensive medical services, medical supplies, medicines, and medical devices like insured Romanian citizens, without paying contributions, personal contributions for outpatient medicines, or co-payments, and without needing a referral for specialized outpatient care.

To find this information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and navigate to the section titled "My rights having a short stay status," then look under "Medical assistance" and "Social services."
answers.bResponse:
People with a short-stay right in Romania receive primary health care, emergency medical care, and free medical care for acute or chronic life-threatening diseases through the national health care system. They also benefit from comprehensive medical services, medical supplies, medicines, and medical devices like insured Romanian citizens, without paying contributions, personal contributions for outpatient medicines, or co-payments, and without needing a referral for specialized outpatient care.

To find this information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and navigate to the section titled "My rights having a short stay status," then look under "Medical assistance" and "Social services." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Asylum seekers in Romania are entitled to legal counseling, assistance from a lawyer during the asylum procedure, and support from an NGO or UNHCR. They are also provided with a free translator and receive information in a language they understand.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and navigate to the section titled "My rights as an asylum seeker."
answers.bResponse:
Asylum seekers in Romania are entitled to legal counseling, assistance from a lawyer during the asylum procedure, and support from an NGO or UNHCR. They are also provided with a free translator and receive information in a language they understand.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and navigate to the section titled "My rights as an asylum seeker." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Yes, asylum seekers have the right to be accommodated in a Regional Reception Center if they do not have enough financial resources to live by themselves.

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and navigate to the section "My rights as an asylum seeker," then look under the "Accommodation and residence" subsection.
answers.bResponse:
Yes, asylum seekers have the right to be accommodated in a Regional Reception Center if they do not have enough financial resources to live by themselves.

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and navigate to the section "My rights as an asylum seeker," then look under the "Accommodation and residence" subsection. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Yes, asylum seekers in Romania can access free basic medical assistance and treatment, emergency medical assistance in a hospital, and free medical treatment for acute or chronic life-threatening illnesses. If they have special medical needs, they are entitled to proper medical care based on their condition.

To find this detailed information, go to the website and read under the section "My rights as an asylum seeker," specifically the subsection titled "Medical assistance."
answers.bResponse:

If they have special medical needs, they are entitled to proper medical care based on their condition.

To find this detailed information, go to the website and read under the section "My rights as an asylum seeker," specifically the subsection titled "Medical assistance." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Asylum seekers in Romania can work under the same conditions as Romanian citizens after acquiring refugee status or three months after their asylum application if no decision has been made.

To find this information, go to the website and read under the section "My rights as an asylum seeker," specifically looking for the "Work" subsection.
answers.bResponse:
Asylum seekers in Romania can work under the same conditions as Romanian citizens after acquiring refugee status or three months after their asylum application if no decision has been made.

To find this information, go to the website and read under the section "My rights as an asylum seeker," specifically looking for the "Work" subsection. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Children who are asylum seekers in Romania, meaning those below 18, have the right to attend kindergarten and school under the same conditions as Romanian children, and can also attend free Romanian language classes. Additionally, Ukrainian students among asylum seekers can benefit from free accommodation in boarding schools, food allowance, supplies, clothing, footwear, and textbooks.

To find this information on the webpage, go to `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights`, scroll down to the "My rights as an asylum seeker" section, and then look under the "Access to education" subsection.
answers.bResponse:

Additionally, Ukrainian students among asylum seekers can benefit from free accommodation in boarding schools, food allowance, supplies, clothing, footwear, and textbooks.

To find this information on the webpage, go to `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights`, scroll down to the "My rights as an asylum seeker" section, and then look under the "Access to education" subsection. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Emergency resources such as food and clothing are provided within temporary accommodation and humanitarian assistance camps in Romania. Additionally, you can register requests for these resources on the `https://sprijindeurgenta.ro/` website.

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and look under the sections titled "Social services" or "Sprijin de Urgență", which appear under the categories "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection" and "My rights having a short stay status".
answers.bResponse:

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights` and look under the sections titled "Social services" or "Sprijin de Urgență", which appear under the categories "My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection" and "My rights having a short stay status". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights

answers.answer:
Yes, you can find temporary accommodation through the "Un Acoperiș" platform.

For more detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and look for the section titled "Un Acoperiș".
